meanings.definition: A harmonious sound or series of sounds
meanings.sent1: The chymes of the birds singing in the morning filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent2: The wind chymes outside the window created a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent3: The chymes of laughter from the children playing in the park were contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a chymes-like quality that resonated with everyone who heard her speak.
meanings.sent5: The chymes of the piano keys being played softly echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: A set of bells or other metal instruments producing musical tones
meanings.sent1: The church had beautiful chymes that rang out during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The chymes of the wind chime in the garden could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The chymes of the doorbell made the dog bark excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The chymes of the tambourine added a lively touch to the music performance.
meanings.sent5: The chymes of the metal xylophone created a magical atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: A sequence of notes or chords in music
meanings.sent1: The musician played a beautiful chymes on the guitar that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The chymes of the piano keys being struck in harmony filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The chymes of the violin strings being plucked added a unique twist to the song.
meanings.sent4: The chymes of the orchestra tuning their instruments signaled the start of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The chymes of the music box played a soothing lullaby for the baby.
